title: ICE: rustdoc on transmute-size-mismatch-before-typeck.rs:  size-changing transmute, should have been caught by transmute checking

labels.name: T-rustdoc
labels.description: Relevant to the rustdoc team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: E-needs-test
labels.description: Call for participation: writing correctness tests

body:
### Code code from `./src/test/ui/consts/transmute-size-mismatch-before-typeck.rs` ```Rust #![feature(const_transmute)] // normalize-stderr-64bit "64 bits" -> "word size" // normalize-stderr-32bit "32 bits" -> "word size" // normalize-stderr-64bit "128 bits" -> "2 * word size" // normalize-stderr-32bit "64 bits" -> "2 * word size" fn main() { match &b""[..] { ZST => {} //~ ERROR could not evaluate constant pattern //~| ERROR could not evaluate constant pattern } } const ZST: &[u8] = unsafe { std::mem::transmute(1usize) }; //~^ ERROR any use of this value will cause an error //~| ERROR cannot transmute between types of different sizes // Once the `any use of this value will cause an error` disappears in this test, make sure to // remove the `TransmuteSizeDiff` error variant and make its emitter site an assertion again. ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustdoc 1.50.0-nightly (1c389ffef 2020-11-24) binary: rustdoc commit-hash: 1c389ffeff814726dec325f0f2b0c99107df2673 commit-date: 2020-11-24 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.50.0-nightly ``` ### Error output ``` error: internal compiler error: size-changing transmute, should have been caught by transmute checking --> ./src/test/ui/consts/transmute-size-mismatch-before-typeck.rs:15:29 | 15 | const ZST: &[u8] = unsafe { std::mem::transmute(1usize) }; | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ | = note: delayed at compiler/rustc_mir/src/interpret/place.rs:922:27 thread 'rustc' panicked at 'no errors encountered even though `delay_span_bug` issued', compiler/rustc_errors/src/lib.rs:974:13 note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.50.0-nightly (1c389ffef 2020-11-24) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu query stack during panic: end of query stack ```
